  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Facility Manager",
  "description": "Fidson Healthcare Plc, proudly Nigerian, is a leading pharmaceutical company which has evolved from being a distributor for multinationals in 1995 to full-fledged manufacturing, sales and marketing company with a strong brand. At Fidson, we support each other to greatness. We not only inspire our people to achieve, but we also celebrate their achievements with them. Together, we work and play hard.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Facility Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Department: Business Operations
Reports To: GM, Business Operations

Key Responsibilities
Building / Facility Maintenance:


	Perform routine inspections and maintenance to ensure all facilities are in excellent working condition.
	Implement preventive and corrective maintenance schedules to minimize downtime and extend asset life.
	Monitor and address issues with plumbing, mechanical, electrical, HVAC, and other systems.
	Coordinate repairs and replacements with external contractors as needed.
	Respond promptly to emergencies and urgent repair needs.
	Handle facility-related complaints and resolve issues quickly.
	Recommend facility improvements, upgrades, or refurbishments.
	Ensure proper waste disposal and management in line with ESG and EMS principles.


Office &amp; Workstation Maintenance:


	Ensure all offices, workstations, and desks are functional and well maintained.
	Monitor and address issues with furniture, lighting, and equipment.


Project Management:


	Support planning and coordination of facility improvement projects.
	Collaborate with external contractors and vendors.
	Ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.


Maintenance of Directors&rsquo; Residences:


	Oversee daily operations and maintenance of Directors&rsquo; residential facilities and utilities (electrical, plumbing, HVAC, generators, water supply, etc.).
	Implement preventive and corrective maintenance schedules for residences.
	Maintain pristine standards of residences and grounds, including landscaping, cleaning, and pest control.


Reporting &amp; Documentation:


	Maintain records of repairs, service schedules, warranties, and equipment manuals.
	Provide weekly, quarterly, half-yearly, and annual reports on key activities and achievements.


Leadership, Vendor &amp; Staff Supervision:


	Supervise facility staff (gardeners, cleaners, technicians, security, etc.) to ensure efficiency.
	Manage vendors, contractors, and service providers for specialized services.
	Negotiate service agreements and monitor contractor performance.
	Coach, mentor, and appraise facility staff.


Budget &amp; Resource Management:


	Develop and manage facility budgets, ensuring cost-effective solutions.
	Monitor and control usage of materials, equipment, and supplies.
	Provide expenditure and facility condition reports periodically.


Requirements


	Minimum Requirements Education: First Degree&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Experience: Minimum of 5 years of cognate experience in facility management.


Required Competency &amp; Work Skills:


	Good knowledge of HSE regulations.
	Strong budget management and cost control skills.
	Excellent knowledge of building systems, equipment, and furniture.
	Strong organizational and project management ability.
	Problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
	Ability to multitask and deliver within deadlines.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	High level of discretion, confidentiality, and trustworthiness.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and digital workplace tools.

Facility Manager Job at Fidson Healthcare Plc




        
    

        
        Fidson Healthcare Plc, proudly Nigerian, is a leading pharmaceutical company which has evolved from being a distributor for multinationals in 1995 to full-fledged manufacturing, sales and marketing company with a strong brand. At Fidson, we support each other to greatness. We not only inspire our people to achieve, but we also celebrate their achievements with them. Together, we work and play hard.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Department: Business Operations
Reports To: GM, Business Operations

Key Responsibilities
Building / Facility Maintenance:
     

            
    




	Perform routine inspections and maintenance to ensure all facilities are in excellent working condition.
	Implement preventive and corrective maintenance schedules to minimize downtime and extend asset life.
	Monitor and address issues with plumbing, mechanical, electrical, HVAC, and other systems.
	Coordinate repairs and replacements with external contractors as needed.
	Respond promptly to emergencies and urgent repair needs.
	Handle facility-related complaints and resolve issues quickly.
	Recommend facility improvements, upgrades, or refurbishments.
	Ensure proper waste disposal and management in line with ESG and EMS principles.


Office & Workstation Maintenance:


	Ensure all offices, workstations, and desks are functional and well maintained.
	Monitor and address issues with furniture, lighting, and equipment.


Project Management:


	Support planning and coordination of facility improvement projects.
	Collaborate with external contractors and vendors.
	Ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.


Maintenance of Directors’ Residences:


	Oversee daily operations and maintenance of Directors’ residential facilities and utilities (electrical, plumbing, HVAC, generators, water supply, etc.).
	Implement preventive and corrective maintenance schedules for residences.
	Maintain pristine standards of residences and grounds, including landscaping, cleaning, and pest control.


Reporting & Documentation:


	Maintain records of repairs, service schedules, warranties, and equipment manuals.
	Provide weekly, quarterly, half-yearly, and annual reports on key activities and achievements.


Leadership, Vendor & Staff Supervision:


	Supervise facility staff (gardeners, cleaners, technicians, security, etc.) to ensure efficiency.
	Manage vendors, contractors, and service providers for specialized services.
	Negotiate service agreements and monitor contractor performance.
	Coach, mentor, and appraise facility staff.


Budget & Resource Management:


	Develop and manage facility budgets, ensuring cost-effective solutions.
	Monitor and control usage of materials, equipment, and supplies.
	Provide expenditure and facility condition reports periodically.


Requirements


	Minimum Requirements Education: First Degree  
	Experience: Minimum of 5 years of cognate experience in facility management.


Required Competency & Work Skills:


	Good knowledge of HSE regulations.
	Strong budget management and cost control skills.
	Excellent knowledge of building systems, equipment, and furniture.
	Strong organizational and project management ability.
	Problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
	Ability to multitask and deliver within deadlines.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	High level of discretion, confidentiality, and trustworthiness.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and digital workplace tools.

Facilities / Operations Manager Job at Premier Hub Innovation Center




        
    

        
        Premier Hub Innovation Center exists to fast-track innovation and enterprise in Nigeria by creating an enabling environment and empowering youths who are leveraging technology to build ideas into sustainable solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facilities / Operations Manager

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

            
    




	The job-holder will oversee and provide a broad range of facilities business operations, project management , Sales / Marketing , Strategic planning and communications support across the team.
	You will be responsible to oversee our organization’s ongoing operations and procedures working towards promoting efficiency, profitability and productivity of the business.
	You’ll have to maintain control of diverse business operations, with the goal of securing the functionality of business to drive extensive and sustainable growth.
	Assist the CEO and board in creating, growing, and building a world class, industry leading organization.
	Supporting the delivery of Premier Hub suite of services such as Premier Center – Workspaces and Training rooms, Programs, CBT Center, Business Support Service and Trainings by providing administrative, coordination, communication, project management support and driving profitability across the business unit.
	Drive Stellar company results from an operational perspective, working closely with the CEO and team members.
	Set Challenging and realistic goals for growth, performance and profitability.
	Assess the capacity needs of organizations operations squad and work with the peoples organization to recruit and train the resources needed in the company to attain its strategic goals.
	Forge Strategic partnership / relationships with clients, vendors, tech firms, start-ups, donor agencies , wider tech sector stakeholders and all other professional relationships using these to support the delivery and development of new partnerships and programmes
	Managing the development of a suite of externally facing marketing and communications materials and platforms that supports Premier Hub’s initiatives.
	Support the Hub’s work by planning and executing high profile events and programmes: assume a key role in planning projects and events such as workshops, hackathons, conferences.
	Support on design and implementation of the Hub’s operational processes, internal infrastructure, reporting system and company policies all designed to foster growth, profitability and efficiencies within the company.
	Motivate and encourage employees at all levels as one of the key leaders in the company.
	Work closely with the management team to set and/or implement policies, procedures, and systems and to follow through with implementation.
	Lead work on to support the initiation, delivery, operations and logistics components for the Hub’s activities;
	Process invoices, payments and manage Hub’s procurement process and operating budget
	Establish business KPIs and conduct regular quality assessments to ensure compliance
	Build processes that meet our business objectives and ensure compliance
	Create and Monitor financial data such as budgeting, forecasting / resource allocation and recommend solutions that will improve profitability.
	Provide accurate and timely reports outlining the operational condition of the company.
	Strategic planning and analysis.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 - 4 years of work experience.

  "description": "Prixair Group is a diversified Nigerian conglomerate founded in 2011 by entrepreneur Demola Banjo. Prixair Group our vision is to be a leading conglomerate that delivers exceptional products and services across various industries, contributing significantly to Nigeria&rsquo;s economic growth and setting benchmarks for excellence and innovation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources / Learning &amp; Development (L&amp;D) Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse Zone 6, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Prixair Group Training Centre
Reports to: COO

Job Summary


	The HR/L&amp;D Manager for Prixair Training Center will be responsible for overseeing all training programs, talent development initiatives, and strategic facility rentals.
	The center, equipped with state-of-the-art modern training facilities, is designed to offer both internal capacity building and commercial training room rentals and leasing services.
	The manager is expected to deliver innovative training programs and aggressively market the facility for public use, with a set revenue target of ?50 million per month.
